DataElement.preferredName: Mean Platelet Volume Measurement Performed Laboratory Procedure Outcome 1 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 1 decimal place numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of the mean platelet volume in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The determination of the average size of the platelets present in a blood sample._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The determination of the average size of the platelets present in a blood sample.

Concepts.definition: The determination of the average size of the platelets present in a blood sample.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::1 Decimal Place Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::1_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::1 Decimal Place Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.:A number with no fractional part.::1:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
